doc.after: When World War II began, the airline continued to grow with the help of Pan Am, which owned 25% of the new Mexican airline. AeromÃ©xico saw few changes for the next two decades. However, during the 1950s, renovation began, and the airline took over various small competitor companies across the country, including AerovÃ­as Guest (the second airline of the country at that time) that held the routes to Madrid and Paris.
